intro: Navidura tingitana, commonly known as the Moroccan thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer, followed by distinctive, warty fruits. Navidura tingitana is often found in rocky or arid habitats, adapting to dry conditions with its deep root system. It has been used traditionally in some regions for its medicinal properties.
